pkgmetadata.longdescription:
Chromium is a open-source web browser
For this ebuild fork, you can build 32 bit Chromium on 64 bit. Multiple ABI installation is in testing. This will allow to use binary only plugins that support a major ABI and allow to continue to use the experimental ABI as the default.
You need to add the following in /etc/portage/profile/package.use.force in order to select a non-native ABI. Tweak below to add your masked ABI. ----- CUT BELOW HERE ----- www-client/chromium -abi_x86_64 -abi_x86_32 -abi_x86_x32 -abi_mips_n64 -abi_ppc_64 -abi_s390_64 ----- CUT ABOVE HERE -----
Per build environment variables:
ECHROMIUM_PGO_URIS - A space delimited URIs to use per tab for the PGO tab creation simulation. If you do not supply, it will use open source websites used websites some open source or open content. Setting this will override the defaults. Sites selected should be widely used and not contain untrusted content.
ECHROMIUM_CUSTOM_TIMEBOX_TIME - Duration in seconds this simulation(s) will last before moving on.
References: CFI - https://www.chromium.org/developers/testing/control-flow-integrity CFI ldflags - https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ControlFlowIntegrity.html PartitionAlloc - https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/base/allocator/partition_allocator/PartitionAlloc.md PGO - https://blog.chromium.org/2020/08/chrome-just-got-faster-with-profile.html TCMalloc (circa 2007) - https://gperftools.github.io/gperftools/tcmalloc.html https://github.com/chromium/chromium/blob/master/build/config/sanitizers/BUILD.gn#L204

use.flag: Uses clang and allows access to clang/llvm related USE flags. Turning on clang implies ThinLTO on.

Compile the build with Control Flow Integrity (CFI) security protections to mitigate against arbitrary code execution caused by from memory corruption attempts from forward edge attacks from virtual functions. The estimated impact is around 1% CPU overhead, around 15% or less code size increase. When a violation is encountered, the program aborts.
Compile the build with mitigation against possible bad casting vulnerabilities in addition to forward edge attack mitigation. When a violation is encountered, the program aborts.
Compile the build with bad function cast checks and non static function pointers checks. When a violation is encountered, the program aborts.
Split build into more shared libraries to speed up linking. Mostly intended for debugging and development, NOT RECOMMENDED for general use.
Enable support for Hangouts and features such as screen sharing
Build Ozone only with headless backend, NOT RECOMMENDED for general use.

Use the allocator provided by the libc implementation. With glibc malloc (ptmalloc2 based) memory reuse is wastefully duplicated between threaded arenas especially for large data. However, the glibc allocator is widely used and tested.
Enable JavaScript type-checking for Chrome's web technology-based UI. Requires Java.
Enable the official build instead of developer build.

Use PartitionAlloc as the default allocator and replacement to TCMalloc. It's designed for security and lower latency, and benefits the most from memory use effiency. It is actively being improved which may present newer bugs. It's the default in 92 and later.
Disable optimized assembly code that is not PIC friendly

Builds with Profile Guided Optimizations to improve -- page loads, input reponsiveness, web reponsiveness -- by ~10% or less. Builds only once with a pregenerated PGO profile. If you prefer libstdc++ use pgo-native instead.
Builds with 2-step Profile Guided Optimizations. Builds PGO using the native customized environment.
Allows PGO simulation step visit websites and image infrastructure for purposes of attempting to increase function signature hits related to tab usage so they do not get demoted to cold sections.

Use the upstream recommended procedure and scripts to generate the measured data. This relies on speedometer2 benchmarks for improving responsiveness and system health benchmarks for improving load times.

Use the ebuild provided scripts to generate the measured data. This uses realistic simulation which users can extend with additional space separated URIs in ECHROMIUM_PGO_URIS and ECHROMIUM_CUSTOM_TIMEBOX_TIME envvars.

One can supply a /etc/portage/pgo-scripts/www-client/chromium/${PV}.sh, where ${PV} is the version, to extend profile-generation. This could be used to run custom scenarios as hints to the compiler. See ebuild for details.

This one checks if user is relaxed for use for GPU benchmarks or readiness for measured PGO profile collection. Ensure that these code paths & function signatures are properly accessible and being measured.

This one checks if user is relaxed for use for audio streaming tests or readiness for measured pgo profile collection. Ensure that these code paths & function signatures are properly accessible and being measured.
Enable codecs for patent-encumbered audio and video formats.
Enable support for remote desktop and screen cast using media-video/pipewire
Build the SUID sandbox, which is only needed on CONFIG_USER_NS=n kernels
Use system ffmpeg instead of the bundled one
Use system icu instead of the bundled one
Use TCMalloc designed for optimizing memory use and reuse. Default in 91.
Unsupported closed-source DRM capability (required for premium web content)
